member.name: M:Akavache.Http.HttpSchedulerExtensions.ScheduleAll(Akavache.Http.IHttpScheduler,System.Action{Akavache.Http.IHttpScheduler})
member.summary: This method allows you to schedule several requests in a group, and cancel them all at once if necessary.
member.param: Use the provided IHttpScheduler to schedule requests. All requests scheduled will be canceled with the same IDisposable returned.
member.returns: A value that when disposed, cancels all requests made in the block.

member.name: T:Akavache.Http.Priorities
member.summary: This enumeration defines the default base priorities associated with the different NetCache instances

member.name: T:Akavache.Http.IHttpScheduler
member.summary: This interface defines a cache for HTTP Requests, it is the Akavache.Http analog to IBlobCache.

member.name: M:Akavache.Http.IHttpScheduler.Schedule(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.Int32,System.Func{System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Schedules an HTTP request to be sent and returns the result along with the content.
member.param: The absolute priority to schedule this request. Higher priorities get scheduled before lower priorities.
This Func is called when the Headers of the HTTP request are first recieved. If Func returns false, the operation should be cancelled and the body should not be returned.
member.returns: A Future result representing the HTTP response as well as the body of the message.

member.name: M:Akavache.Http.IHttpScheduler.CancelAll
member.summary: Cancel all outstanding requests that are in-flight.

member.name: P:Akavache.Http.IHttpScheduler.Client
member.summary: The HttpClient instance to use to send requests.

member.name: T:Akavache.Http.ISpeculativeHttpScheduler
member.summary: Speculative HTTP schedulers only allow a certain number of bytes to be read before cancelling all future requests. This is designed for reading data that may or may not be used by the user later, in order to improve response times should the user later request the data.

member.name: M:Akavache.Http.ISpeculativeHttpScheduler.ResetLimit(System.Nullable{System.Int64})
member.summary: Resets the total limit of bytes to read. This is usually called when the app resumes from suspend, to indicate that we should fetch another set of data.

member.name: P:Akavache.Http.NetCache.Speculative
member.summary: Speculative HTTP schedulers only allow a certain number of bytes to be read before cancelling all future requests. This is designed for reading data that may or may not be used by the user later, in order to improve response times should the user later request the data.

member.name: P:Akavache.Http.NetCache.UserInitiated
member.summary: This scheduler should be used for requests initiated by a user action such as clicking an item, they have the highest priority.

member.name: P:Akavache.Http.NetCache.Background
member.summary: This scheduler should be used for requests initiated in the background, and are scheduled at a lower priority.
